{"step_by_step_thinking": "Ossifying fibroma is a benign fibro-osseous lesion that typically occurs in the jaws. It is characterized by the formation of mature bone within the lesion. When it comes to radiographic appearance, ossifying fibroma usually presents as a unilocular radiolucency. This means that it appears as a well-defined, single radiolucent area on the radiograph. Therefore, the correct answer is A. Unilocular radiolucency.", "answer_choice": "A"}
